The following are necessary steps to create a SVMAQ Document for upload to Aquarius

# Fill out site information

## **Page you open with.**

![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_01_Opening.png)

## Fill In General Information

![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_02_Opening half filled.png)

-   **STATION** ( Site Number, ie Avery Brook **01171000** )
-   **Station Name** - (Auto Fills)
-   **Date** ( Date of gage visit )
-   **Time** ( Time of Arrival at Gage ) ( Don't change for Daylight vs Non Daylight )
-   **Party** ( Initials of all personal present for site visit )

WEA

![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_03_Weather.png)

1.  Filled out

    ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_03.5_Weather Filled.png)

2.  **Comments**

    ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_04_Opening Filled.png)

    1.  **Options**
        1.  **Site Visit** = ( Tape Down, Control Inspection )
        2.  **QM** = ( Flow Measurement )
        3.  **GHZF** = ( Gage Height at Zero Flow )
        4.  **CSG** = ( Crest Stage Gage - Bucket Test, and Read )
        5.  **Levels** = Level Set Done
        6.  **Camera Download** = ( FPE camera was downloaded. )
    2.  Comment on anything that will be valuable to an accurate discharge monitoring.
        1.  Tree blocking control.

        2.  Gage fallen.

3.  **Save File**

    1.  Click **File** then **Save As...**

        ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_4.1_SaveFile.png)

    ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_4.2_SaveFile2.png)

    1.  File Gets Saved .

        1.  Site Number ( 01171000 )

        2.  Date ( 20220604 )

        3.  Start Time ( 102900 )

        ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_4.3_SaveFile3.png)

    # SITE VISIT TASKS

    -   Click on Button in bottom right of screen **SITE VISIT TASKS**

    ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_05_Options.png)

    -   **Options**
        -   **GZF Inspection** - Gage Height at Zero Flow

        -   **Control Inspection** - Where you enter weather the control is blocked.

        -   **Sensor Inspections** - Put your Stage readings in whether it be from a reference point or a real time sensor.

            -   **CSG Data** will go in here.

        -   **Station Levels** - Both where levels are entered and all RP and RM values are stored.

        -   **Discharge Measurement** - Where both flow tracker files is stored and any information corresponding to the sensor.
    -   **Tip**
        -   To get into any tab just click on yellow box.

    ## **Control Inspection**

    1.  **Blank**

    ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_06_Control Conditions Blank.png)

    2.  **Filled**

    ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_06_Control Conditions Filled.png)

    1.  **Options**

        1.  **Control Type** ( Section, Channel , Combined chan/sect )

            1.  **Section**

                ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SitePhotos/Section Control.png)

            2.  **Channel**

                ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SitePhotos/Channel Control.png)

        2.  **Distance to gage (ft)** - How far away the control is from the sensor.

        3.  **Control Cleaned** - If there is debris blocking the flow of water through the control was it removed?

            1.  If Yes specify the Time debris was removed.

        4.  **Control Condition**

            1.  If control was clear select Clear.

            2.  If control was not specify the type of debris and degree it was blocking the control.

        5.  **Comments**

            1.  If control was clear write "Control was Clear"

            2.  If control was not clear write what was affecting it.

            3.  If control has changed note that too. ( Scour, Fill or Channel Shape has changed.)

4.  **Sensor Inspection**

    1.  Click on **Sensor Inspections**.

        ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_10_SensorInspection.png)

    2.  **Math Entry**

        1.  We do this with our initial gage height reading from a RP to make sure the math is correct.

        2.  Highlight Line with **RP** then click **Create/View Inspection.**

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_11_Inspection View.png)

        3.  By pressing this, a panel containing a blank sheet to do the mathematics calculation of gage height will open.

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_12_Black Math Page.png)

        4.  **What to enter**

            1.  RP Value with label ( **4.892 (RP-1)** )

            2.  -/+ depending if it was a Tape Up or Tape Down ( **-** )

            3.  Tape Up or Down Value ( **1.00** )

            4.  Value Not Rounded to Hundredth of a foot. ( **3.892** )

            5.  Rounded Value ( **3.89** )

        5.  **Finished Entry**

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_13_Filled Math Page.png)

    3.  **Sensor Heights Entry**

        1.  Highlight RP Line and Click on Gage Readings

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_10_SensorInspection.png)

        2.  Page with all the sensors that measure gage height corresponding to a gage.

        3.  Click on the box below **RP Gage height Gage height, reference point ft.**

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_15_SensorInspection Value Blank.png)

        4.  Enter in Initial Gage Height value from RP. **3.88** and click **DONE**

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_16_Value Entry.png)

        5.  Next Enter both

            1.  **Time of Reading**

            2.  **Uncertainty** to the left of units. This is how uncertain you are about your measurement. It will increase if the water is bobbing up and down like in a large storm.

                1.  For this visit the the water was bobbing slightly so I am +/- 0.02 uncertainty about my measured value of 1.00 foot.

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_017_PR Entry.png)

        6.  When done click **ADD**

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_18_RP Filled.png)

        7.  For **Real Time Only** If not Skip to Step 8.

            1.  If sensor reading was at same time as Initial RP enter on same line. If not enter on new line.

            2.  Click on box corresponding to sensor read and enter value read, time but not uncertainty.

            3.  When done click add.

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_19_RealTime First Filled.png)

        8.  Repeat Steps 3-7 until all sensor values are entered.

        9.  When all values are entered hit **Done.**

            ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_20_All Values entered.png)

5.  **GHZ Inspection**

    1.  **Blank**

    ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_07_Gage Height at Zero Flow Blank.png)

    2.  **Filled**
        1.  **Options**

            1.  **Time** - Time GHZF was taken.

            2.  **Stage (ft)** - Stage at time of GHZF measurement

            3.  **Water Depth (ft)** - water depth of GHZF

                1.  Uncertainty of the water depth measurement.

            4.  **GZF (ft)** - **Auto Fills** base off Stage and Water Depth Values

            5.  **Comment** - Tell where in the control the GHZF was taken.

    ![](Documents/StreamGaging/SVMAQ SOP/SVMAQ_SOP Photos/SVMAQ_08_Gage Height at Zero Flow Filled.png)

6.  Options
